subject: Ethics
title: Nuclear Proliferation Ethics
description: A quick win: understand Nuclear Proliferation Ethics.

hook.text: Nine countries have nuclear weapons. They tell everyone else: you can't have them. Is that fair?

buildup.text: The Non-Proliferation Treaty says nuclear states must disarm, and non-nuclear states must stay that way.

discovery.text: The deal was simple: give up nukes, get peaceful nuclear energy. But nuclear states never disarmed.

twist.text: Countries like North Korea saw what happened to Libya after it gave up weaponsâ€”and decided to keep theirs.

climax.text: The ethical paradox: the countries telling others not to build bombs are the only ones who've used them.

punchline.text: Don't build what we built. Do as we say, not as we did.

quiz.question: Why did North Korea resist nuclear disarmament?
options: It observed that Libya was overthrown after voluntarily giving up its weapons program
It was never a signatory to any non-proliferation agreement
It needed nuclear energy because it lacked fossil fuel resources
